snippet: The defendants, many of them members of an extended family, secured loans by overstating their income and bank account balances, the authorities said.
abstract: United States attorney in Manhattan charges Irving Rubin and 14 other men and women, mostly members of his extended family, with defrauding banks and other lending institutions out of $20 million by securing mortgage loans, over 10-year period, based on false financial information.

byline.contributor: William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting from New York, and Bernard Vaughan from White Plains.

lead_paragraph: The defendants, many of them members of an extended family, secured loans by overstating their income and bank account balances, the authorities said.

headline.main: 15 Are Charged With Defrauding Banks and Other Lenders of $20 Million
headline.print_headline: 15 Are Charged With Defrauding Banks and Other Lenders of $20 Million
